area.key: Select the document type you wish to map against
Select the property you wish to use as title. Titles are used as mouseover tooltips on map markers.
Select the property you wish to use for the coordinates. Coordinates are used to place the markers on the map.
The alias of the map - should be unique.
Select the datasource for the map.
Choose whether to use hybrid map as default. (Default = ROADMAP)
Choose whether geo location is enabled or not.
Set the initial zoom level of the map.
Set the minimum amount of zoom possible.
Set the maximum amount of zoom possible.
URL for the icon you wish to use for the marker icon. Should be of type PNG.
Needs to be the same width as the PNG selected above. This is required because of a limitation in Google Maps API.
Needs to be the same height as the PNG selected above. This is required because of a limitation in Google Maps API.
Should only be enabled if the map is used for a single marker.
Choose whether you wish to use info windows or not.
The desired width of the info window.
The name of the partial you wish to use for rendering info windows. These partials should be placed in "Views/Partials/MapBuilder/InfoWindows"
Choose whether you wish to enable dragging the map or not.
Choose whether you wish to enable scrolling of the map or not.
Choose whether you wish to enable zoom controls or not.
Choose whether you wish to enable map type controls or not.
Choose whether you wish to enable street view controls or not.
Choose whether you wish to use clustering or not.
The URL for the cluster icon.
Needs to be the same width as the PNG selected above. This is required because of a limitation in Google Maps API.
Needs to be the same height as the PNG selected above. This is required because of a limitation in Google Maps API.
The top anchor for the icon. Might need to play around with this before wanted results is achieved.
The left anchor for the icon. Might need to play around with this before wanted results is achieved.
Select the color of the text which is used to present how many markers is in a cluster.
